business.headline: How to execute a will properly, so your family avoids delays and disputesThe truth is, writing a will is only half the job. The real work begins afterwards. One missing document, one unclear clause or one forgotten instruction is enough to turn a simple inheritance into months of delay and dispute.

Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

entertainment.headline: Dining With The Kapoors trailer: A feast of food, family secrets and Kapoor madness Netflix unveiled the trailer of the upcoming documentary special 'Dining With The Kapoors'. It offers an inside look at the Kapoor family as they gather to celebrate Raj Kapoor's 100th birthday.

#PriyankaChopraIsBack: 'GlobeTrotter' look as Mandakini goes viral in 24 hours Priyanka Chopra's first-look poster as Mandakini from SS Rajamouli's upcoming film starring Mahesh Babu has gone viral in barely 24 hours, ahead of the film's grand event in Hyderabad on November 15

SAG Awards renamed to The Actor Awards by SAG-AFTRA after 30 years The longstanding Screen Actors Guild Awards have now adopted a new title aligning with its signature statuette and union merger, reflecting its evolving identity while maintaining core values and traditions.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 1: Ajay's film starts strong with Rs 9.45 crore Ajay Devgn's latest release 'De De Pyaar De 2' released in theatres on November 14. The film, which received rave reviews, opened on an impressive note at the box office.

Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur to arrive 3 days ahead of schedule, but there's a catch As fans eagerly wait for Farhan Akhtar's '120 Bahadur', IndiaToday.in has exclusively learned that the makers have decided to release the film before its scheduled date. However, there's a twist.

Chupke Chupke: When Dharmendra and Amitabh got into a prank war As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Chupke Chupke. The film, released in 1975, the same year as Sholay, turned Dharmendra's iconic "Garam Dharam" image upside down with a wink and a laugh.

At 60, SRK's Chaiyya Chaiyya moves with Farah wow fans all over again. Watch Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan and choreographer Farah Khan entertained attendees at a recent Mumbai event, marking the unveiling of the Shahrukhz tower, with a dance performance to the classic song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya'. The event drew attention both for the property launch and Khan's noteworthy energy at 60.

Wuthering Heights trailer: Margot Robbie, Jacob Elordi blaze in dark love tale The trailer for Emerald Fennell's adaptation of Emily Bronte's novel 'Wuthering Heights', starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, was released on Thursday. The preview highlights the characters' early connection and the challenges they face as they grow older.

Dining With The Kapoors: Kareena finds Taimur's twin in Saif's childhood pic Netflix has unveiled a teaser for 'Dining With The Kapoors', offering viewers an intimate look at the Kapoor family's traditions and playful moments ahead of the show's trailer release.

Rajkummar Rao, Patralekhaa welcome baby girl on 4th wedding anniversary Congratulations have been pouring in for the couple, Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, as they welcomed a baby girl on their fourth wedding anniversary. The two, who got married in 2021, announced their pregnancy in July.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agency South Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19: And then there were nine, so who'll be crowned winner? 'Bigg Boss 19', hosted by Salman Khan, is set to conclude soon with nine finalists battling for the trophy. Here are all the contestants, with their pros, cons and equation with the host.

BB 19 Day 83: Gaurav overthrown after ration cut; Malti faces sexuality rumours Day 83 of Bigg Boss 19 saw Gaurav Khanna rapidly dethroned after sacrificing the ration for captaincy, landing him in nominations. The episode escalated with a sexuality discussion about Malti Chahar, a major Tanya-Farrhana clash, and Pranit More's stand-up critique.

In Your Dreams review: Netflix serves up a warm, dreamy, feel-good storyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 In Your Dreams movie review: Netflix's animated film is a heartwarming story of a brother-sister duo out on a dreamy adventure to ensure their 'family stay together, happily'.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proud Shah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.

Tere Ishk Mein trailer: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon unleash love's madness, heartbreak The trailer of Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's much-awaited film 'Tere Ishk Mein' is finally out. Directed by Aanand L Rai, the film is slated to release on November 28.

Michelle Yeoh to receive Honourary Golden Bear at Berlinale Palast 2026 Actor Michelle Yeoh will receive the Honorary Golden Bear at the 2026 Berlinale for her outstanding film career. This recognition highlights her impact on global cinema and marks a historic milestone for Asian artists.

Saiyaara gets Popular Choice Award at Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025 Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its winning streak by bagging the Popular Choice Award at the Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025. With Rs 570 crore worldwide earnings and a historic Billboard Top 10 track, the romantic drama stands as one of Indian cinema's most celebrated love stories.

Kajol jokes she wishes to shrink Yug and Nysa, celebrates Children's Day Kajol shared adorable pictures with Yug and Nysa Devgn on Children's Day. She offered a lighthearted perspective on parenting, saying can we just shrink them? Check out the post here.

general news.headline: Nitrate seized from terrorists explodes in J&K police station, kills 9The blast, triggered during the handling of explosives seized in the Faridabad terror module case, ripped through Srinagar's Nowgam Police Station on Friday night.

Punjab woman goes missing in Pak during jatha, converts to Islam, marries localSarabjeet Kaur, a Sikh pilgrim from Punjab, went missing during a religious visit to Pakistan and is said to have converted to Islam and married there.

Who is Dr Nisar Hassan, 'ticking time bomb' under lens in Faridabad terror probeOnce dismissed as a "ticking time bomb" by the Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor for alleged separatist leanings, Dr Nisar ul Hassan is back under scrutiny as investigators probe his links to a "white-collar" Jaish module tied to the Red Fort blast case.

Big blow for India as Shubman Gill retires hurt with injury scare in KolkataIndia were handed an early concern on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test after captain Shubman Gill walked off the field with a neck strain, cutting short his innings only moments after arriving at the crease.

Wed-cations to convertible couture, what all to expect this shaadi seasonThe wedding season has officially begun, and this year comes with fresh trends, new ideas, and a whole lot of personality. Curious about what's in and what's fading out? We asked the experts to break it down.

Tim Cook could soon be leaving and here is the top contender for next Apple CEOApple is reportedly ramping up its succession planning as CEO Tim Cook, who turned 65 this month, prepares to potentially step down as early as next year.

The curse of Dara Sikoh in Bihar?The Yadav family feud wasn't a private affair. It was a political earthquake. Tej Pratap's rebellion, Rohini Acharya's social media storm, and their widening rift with Tejashwi split loyalties and handed the NDA a golden opportunity to paint the RJD as a party consumed by infighting. An ageing patriarch, Lalu Prasad Yadav, is now left to witness the unravelling of the political dynasty he built.

IPL 2026: Arjun Tendulkar and Shami move to LSG, Nitish Rana heads to DCLSG have completed a double move to secure the services of Arjun Tendulkar and Mohammed Shami from MI and SRH respectively. DC got the services of Nitish Rana from RR as they sent Donovan Ferreira in the other direction.

Video: CCTV shows shockwaves from Red Fort blast shaking ground 40 feet belowExclusive CCTV from the underground Red Fort Metro station shows how fierce the blast was. The tremors shook the station nearly 40 feet below, jolting food counters and startling commuters. The violent vibration captured on camera underlines the sheer force of the explosion above.

Congress chief huddles with top leaders after Bihar debacle, Rahul Gandhi presentCongress chief Mallikarjun Kharge met Rahul Gandhi and senior leaders in New Delhi a day after the NDA's sweeping Bihar win, as the grand old party reviewed its sharp seat fall.

Rajkummar Rao, Patralekhaa welcome baby girl on 4th wedding anniversaryCongratulations have been pouring in for the couple, Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, as they welcomed a baby girl on their fourth wedding anniversary. The two, who got married in 2021, announced their pregnancy in July.

In its lone win in Bihar, Mayawati's BSP edges past BJP by just 30 votesBSP candidate Satish Kumar Yadav clinched a razor-thin 30-vote victory in Ramgarh, his party's lone win in Bihar, after a tense count.

How Nitish Kumar powered NDA's 200+ punch that knocked Opposition coldIn a state deeply entrenched in caste politics, Nitish Kumar, a Kurmi who makes up barely 3% of the population, rose above caste lines to deliver a counter-punch to his opponents - who have historically boasted of holding sway over Muslims and Yadavs, who together constitute 32%.

Live: Bihar result unbelievable, will come out with concrete proof, says CongressBihar Election News: High-level political deliberations are underway in Patna and Delhi on Saturday, a day after the NDA swept to power in Bihar with a stunning mandate of 202 seats, with the BJP emerging as the single largest party. Discussions on government formation are expected to intensify in the coming hours, with Nitish Kumar projected to continue as the Chief Minister. Croatia secure World Cup 2026 spot, Germany and Netherlands edge closer Croatia secured automatic qualification for the World Cup after a 3–1 comeback win against the Faroe Islands, while Germany and the Netherlands moved closer to booking their places following tense qualifiers.

Rishabh Pant breaks Virender Sehwag's record with most Test sixes for India Rishabh Pant broke Virender Sehwag's record for the most Test sixes by an Indian, moving to 92 with a blistering knock on Day 2 at Eden Gardens. His fearless 27 off 24 balls lifted him to seventh on the all-time global six-hitters list.

Jadeja left Chennai after being one of their most decorated players and spending 12 seasons.

World champion Deepti Sharma felicitated at UP Police Headquarters in LucknowDeepti Sharma, the Player of the Tournament at the Women's ODI World Cup and newly appointed DSP in the Uttar Pradesh Police under the sports quota, was felicitated on Friday at the State Police Headquarters in Gomtinagar Extension.

IPL 2026 retentions complete guide: Rules, live streaming details, team purseThe deadline for all ten franchises of the Indian Premier League to reveal their list of retained and released players is 15th November 2024. As the teams finalise their squad for the mini auction scheduled in December, here's our complete guide to IPL 2026 retention rules.

Devon Conway confirms CSK exit ahead of IPL 2026 retentions, thanks fansNew Zealand opener Devon Conway has confirmed his release from the Chennai Super Kings on Friday, November 14, a day ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions. Conway spent three years with CSK and thanked the fans.

Babar Azam ends 807-day century drought, equals Saeed Anwar's ODI recordBabar Azam ended his 807-day century drought with an unbeaten 102 against Sri Lanka in the 2nd ODI in Rawalpindi. His innings helped Pakistan chase down 289 and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada's availability remains uncertain for 2nd TestKagiso Rabada remains a doubtful starter for the second Test against India after missing the series opener due to a rib injury. South Africa are awaiting further medical assessments to determine his availability.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi rates his 42-ball 144 out of 100Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi lit up Doha with a stunning 42-ball 144, but the 14-year-old wasn't fully satisfied. Even after one of the biggest knocks of his young career, he rated it with striking honesty and restraint.

No magic, just mastery: Jasprit Bumrah on dismantling South Africa in Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah turned a dry Eden Gardens pitch into his stage, ripping through South Africa with a superb five-for. After silencing fitness critics, he reminded everyone that his craft isn't magic but pure skill, patience and relentless accuracy.

South Africa coach plays down Jasprit Bumrah's 'bauna' remark for Temba BavumaSouth Africa batting coach Ashwell Prince has dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's on-field remark about Temba Bavuma during the opening day of the first Test at Eden Gardens. Prince clarified that the team will not discuss the incident, while no complaint will be made regarding the exchange captured on the stump mic.

Mohammed Shami set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants for IPL 2026: ReportIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Mohammed Shami is set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026). Shami was bought for Rs 10 Crore at IPL 2025 mega auction but failed to live up to his reputation.

Control your temptation: Jasprit Bumrah's guide to acing tricky Eden Gardens pitchIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: After claiming a sensational five-wicket haul, Jasprit Bumrah explained why it isn't easy for fast bowlers to find success on a dry pitch like the one at Eden Gardens on Day 1 of the series opener in Kolkata.

Hardik Pandya kept in touch, motivated me: Allah Ghazanfar hopes to be retained by MIAM Ghazanfar, Afghanistan's 19-year-old mystery spinner, reflects on a demanding year and looks ahead to potential retention by the Mumbai Indians for the 2026 IPL season.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: DC eye reset in overseas combination, pace unitAs the Delhi Capitals gear up for IPL 2026, they will be eager to address some glaring weaknesses in their squad ahead of the mini-auction. An overhaul of the overseas opening slot and a reset in the fast-bowling department will be among their top priorities. With the 15 November deadline approaching, here's a probable list of players DC are expected to retain.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
